query.description: Path to Assets in your system that you want to generate a report from
assetPath
folderPath
true/false
true/false
Comma-delimited list of extensions
Required. Query asking for Assets with the value of 'apollo'. Lots of ways to query. Start here for docs: https://helpcenter.woodwing.com/hc/en-us/articles/360041851432
Optional First hit to be returned. Starting at 0 for the first hit. Used for paging
Optional. Number of hits to return. Default is 50. 0 returns no hits.
Optional. The sort order of returned hits. Comma-delimited list of fields to sort on.
Optional. For all fields use 'metadataToReturn=all', Leave null for only minimal fields. Default returns all fields.
Optional. Comma-delimited list fiels to return facets for. Ex: facets=tags,assetDomain
Optional. Replace <field> with the appropriate field you want. Ex: facet.assetDomain.selection=image,video
Optional. Default is false. Use when retrieving thumb, preview or original URL's and you won't need to authenticate against the server again.
Optional. Default is true. Any found text is highlighted.
Optional. Default for 6.75 and higher is false, 6.74 and lower true.  Collections returned in the results have an additional array with up to 4 thumbnailHits
Optional. Default is true. When set to true, an entry for this search is written to the Stats index.

query.description: The source image TO copy. This is the assetPath value
The destination path of the file plus the name

header.description: Get the token from the login values returned

query.description: Required. The folderPath or assetPath to asset to be moved or renamed

Required. The folderPath or assetPath to which the folder or asset should be moved or renamed. If the parent folder is the same as in the source path, the asset will be renamed, otherwise it will be moved.
Optional. Policy used when destination folder already exists. Options are: AUTO_RENAME, MERGE, THROW_EXCEPTION. if Omitted AUTO_RENAME will be be used.
Optional. Policy used when destination asset already exists. Options: AUTO_RENAME, OVERWRITE, OVERWRITE_IF_NEWER, REMOVE_SOURCE, THROW_EXCEPTION, DO_NOTHING. if Omitted AUTO_RENAME will be be used.
Optional. When specified, only source assets that match this query will be moved.
Optional. True/False. When set to true will move all files from source subfolders to directly below the target folder. This will 'flatten' any subfolder structure.
Optional. True/False. When true, the process will run asynchronous in the background. The call will return immediate with the processId.
Optional. When true, the process will run asynchronous in the background. The call will return immediate with the processId.

header.description: Use the X-CSRF-TOKEN value from your login

query.description: A query matching the assets that should be updated, see the query syntax guide for details.

Optional. A JSON encoded object with properties that match Assets Server metadata field names. This metadata will be set on the asset in Assets Server.

Optional. You can also use parameters matching Assets Server field names.
Any parameter matching an Assets Server metadata field name will be used as metadata. This metadata will be set on the asset in Assets Server.
Optional. When true, the process will run asynchronous in the background. The call will return immediate with the processId.
Optional. Default true. Prevents parsing "+" and "-" when set to false.

header.description: Use the X-CSRF-TOKEN value from your login

formdata.description: Required. The Assets Server id of the asset to be updated.
Optional. If not included only metadata is updated
Optional. JSON Encoded object. You can also use parameters matching Assets Server field names.
Comma-delimited list of metadata fields to return in hits. It is good practice to always specify just the metadata fields that you need.

Optional. When specified, the service will send a 301 redirect to this URL when it completes successfully. If you place '${id}' in the URL, it will be replaced with the Assets Server asset id of the updated asset.

header.description: Use the X-CSRF-TOKEN value from your login

Number of hits to return.
Optional. Default is 0. Can be customized.
Optional. Default is empty. Returns all actions.
value

body.raw:
{
        "id": "",
        "name": "Jeff Gapp API Preset",
        "type": "IMAGE_PRESET",
        "creator": "Sam Spade",
        "sharedWithAuthKey": false,
        "sharedWithGroups": [
            ""
        ],
        "renditionSettings": {
            "format": "jpg",
            "scale": 50.0,
            "maxWidth": 100,
            "maxHeight": 100,
            "maxLength": -1,
            "ppi": 72,
            "ppiEnabled": true,
            "page": -1,
            "embedMetadata": true,
            "embedColorProfile": true,
            "compression": "",
            "quality": 100,
            "resizeMode": "scale",
            "watermarked": false,
            "background": "",
            "cropWidth": -1,
            "cropHeight": -1,
            "cropOffsetX": -1,
            "cropOffsetY": -1,
            "skipfront": -1
        }
    }
]

query.description: Required. ID of preset rendition
Comma separated list of locales. Default is us_EN.
Optional. The date of the last requested cached messages. Use this when caching the messages in your client locally. If omitted then the messages will always be returned.
Optional. Default is web. Options are 'web' or 'acm'
Required. ID of the asset which needs to be reverted.
Version number of the version to which the asset needs to be reverted.
The search query.
The offset from the first result you want to fetch. Default is 0.
The maximum amount of hits to be returned. Default is 10.
Number of minutes the URL is valid for. -1 provides a URL that doesn't expire.
Required. Values are jpg, png, tiff

Scales the width and height of the rendition relative to the original size. The scale is in percentages from 1 to 100. If used in combination with maxWidth or maxHeight the image will be scaled with a maximum size.

Sets the maximum width of the preview. The aspect ratio will always remain the same. If the original asset fits within the supplied dimensions, the original width and height will be used for generating the rendition.

Sets the maximum height of the preview. The aspect ratio will always remain the same. If the original asset fits within the supplied dimensions, the original width and height will be used for generating the rendition.
The pixels per inch / dots per inch can be set to any desired value. When not set, the original PPI / DPI value of the asset will be used.

When set to true, the metadata embedded in the original asset will be embedded in the generated rendition. Note that for certain file types the embedding of metadata is not supported, for example for PNG files. By default the original metadata is not embedded.
When set to true, the color profile that is used to generate the rendition is included.
TIFF Compression type, applicable when format=tif. Allowed values: uncompressed, packBits, LZW, ZIP and JPEG.
JPEG compression, applicable when format=jpg. The quality is defined a value from 1 to 100.
When set to true, a watermark is applied to the rendition. Note: a watermark needs to be configured in the server configuration.
Sets the background color (hex color code) for transparent images. If not specified, the output of PNG and TIFF images will be transparent.
Sets the width (in pixels) to which the image should be cropped.
Sets the height (in pixels) to which the image should be cropped.
Sets the crop x offset in pixels (from the top left corner).
Sets the crop y offset in pixels (from the top left corner).
Number of minutes the URL is valid for. -1 provides a URL that doesn't expire.
Number of minutes the URL is valid for. -1 provides a URL that doesn't expire.
Number of minutes the URL is valid for. -1 provides a URL that doesn't expire.
Path to the folder you want
Folder identifier (generally top level)
The offset from the first result you want to fetch. Default value : 0
The maximum amount of hits to be returned. Default value : 10

Metadata fields to return for folders. Specify all to return all available metadata. Specify none to return no metadata.

Default value : all
Folder identifier (generally top level)
The offset from the first result you want to fetch. Default value : 0
The maximum amount of hits to be returned. Default value : 10

Metadata fields to return for folders. Specify all to return all available metadata. Specify none to return no metadata.

Default value : all
